website_summaries.verdict: Compact and sturdy, this espresso maker is particularly loved for the high-quality espresso it consistently produces.
pros: Ships with a built-in espresso cup and scoop
Consistently works well and makes a superior espresso
cons: Tamping down the grounds in the filter basket can cause a seal to blow out in the pump
This option is a little difficult to clean well, as it doesn't break down completely
Some find this maker difficult to use

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this. I’ve been looking for a way to make espresso at home that wouldn’t take up precious counter space in my small apartment. I’ve also been wanting to switch from pour over to espresso because pour over makes me jittery. I got the larger reservoir accessory pack and can pull 3 espresso shots in about 10 min (including grinding, packing the shots, and switching the basket with the grounds out between shots). The taste is amazing and the whole set up is exactly what I needed. I also like that it isn’t noisy like an electric espresso machine.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Does not work and can’t return!!! Waste $50
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars. Doesn’t work. I tried 3 different times, first with espresso grind, and twice with a more coarsesly ground coffee. Nothing comes out of the end. It’s clearly a defect because the water seal end is just a hair uneven. I tried screwing it on many times, it’s defective. This item cannot be returned on amazon or the Wacaco website.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Happy Hippies
customer_reviews.text: We go to a lot of music festivals and camp. My one thing I hated was not having a good cup of coffee in the morning. This little thing made my day! My only complaint is that it only makes a single shot at a time. When there is a camp full of morning faced hippies waiting for a cup of coffee it can take a while! They do sell a larger water tank and extra grounds cups which I will definitely pick up before next festival season. This little gadget is a game changer with good, strong, and crema rich shots. Lattes for all!
customer_reviews.author: Frater Zion

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Purchase of 2016
customer_reviews.text: I just need to express how obsessed I am with this espresso machine. I was so sick of either buying terrible coffee at dunkin or starbucks or over paying at local coffee shops. This has saved me from late nights, early mornings and mid-day sleepies at work. I recommend this to anyone who is a bit of a coffee snob or just doesn't feel like paying for over priced joe everyday. This would also just be a cool gift to a coffee lover for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Perez

customer_reviews.title: Made in China - No return policy!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know it was made in China. I don't trust items that hold food or drink that are made in China. There is no return policy for this item. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Keyes

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good!
customer_reviews.text: We don't travel with this, rather, we just use it at home for an espresso shot needed here and there. It is a bit fussy to make two in a row with the rinsing between but it yields delicious shots of espresso so it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great while it lasted (hint - it wasn't long)
customer_reviews.text: cool idea, cute little thing. Somewhat cumbersome to use, but still would be worth at least 4 stars - but it broke after 5-10 uses. Something popped inside and now it doesn't hold pressure, so its pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: Adam G.

customer_reviews.title: It worked great at first but now leaks all over and is ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband as a Christmas gift and it already doesn't work in less than 90 days of use. It worked great at first but now leaks all over and is simply un-usable now. Amazon won't let me return it and says I have to go to Manufacturer. Not happy one bit. Update: per Wacaco they have a 12 month warrantly so they are trying to help me but just asked for pictures or video of the leaking. Really? I guess they are going to say they want to fix this one? I told them I want a new one altogether and I’ll send this one back and they can figure it out. Will see where that goes.
customer_reviews.author: 3Brands

customer_reviews.title: One of the best items I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes you buy something, and you're just so glad you did. This is one of those products. This makes great espresso and is very easy to travel with. I bought the bigger water tank, which is interchangeable with the existing smaller water tank, just to be able to make more espresso more quickly. To use it, I first run through boiling water WITHOUT any espresso, then to make the espresso, I follow the instructions for use. After I've made the espresso, I run through boiling water again to clean it. I couldn't be happier with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Earth3003

customer_reviews.title: Think twice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to use on a sailboat trio from New Caledonia to Australia. I tried it at home before I left and it worked fine. When I got to the boat the first time I tried to make coffee the coffee filter cracked. This made it impossible to make coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S

customer_reviews.title: It is not easy to use at all
customer_reviews.text: I used this machine maybe 5 times until it did not work any more. It is not easy to use at all. The hand pump clogs and barely retracts when using (some sort of vacuum is created that keeps it from moving). Not practical at all.
customer_reviews.author: Henri

customer_reviews.title: NO GO ESPRESSO
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 3 cups. Gaskets not good... good thought, crappy design
customer_reviews.author: amy phaneuf

customer_reviews.title: That can't be right...!
customer_reviews.text: I carefully followed the instructions the first time I used this espresso maker. After 6 pumps, still no espresso. After about 9 pumps there was a hiss, like a seal popped. On each subsequent pump, a little espresso would come out (not as much as the videos show), and hot water would spurt out from the base of the pump arm. Based on other reviews, this isn't unheard of, but I think this particular espresso maker must be defective.
customer_reviews.author: Sverre LeRoy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth it
customer_reviews.text: My husband got hooked on lattes and frappes last year and was spending a fortune on them every day. He always bought at least two per day, and it was adding up quick. I finally bought an espresso machine for the house, and while it made a huge difference, he was still buying a drink during the workday. Then I found this brilliant little device. It's perfect for espresso on the go because its completely manually operated. No need for an outlet, or even batteries. As long as you have access to hot water, you can make a perfect espresso shot. Two very enthusiastic thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Leo LeonardTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but very small volume
customer_reviews.text: This works fine. It's a bit laborious to assemble and clean each time, but does what it is meant to and produces good espresso. My disappointment is not with the quality of the product but that the volume it produces is so small. Only half-fills my little espresso cup. Not sure if this is user error or just the way it is meant to be.
customer_reviews.author: TMW_Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as advertised. Far away from preparing espressos.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work as advertised. It prepares a week coffe, far from what a espresso should be. And it’s not eligible for return.
customer_reviews.author: Regis ASSAO

customer_reviews.title: Leaking water. Doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: Leaking water trough the pump. Company's support is awful - trying to return or get support for the item - none is available. Don't waste b your money
customer_reviews.author: Mariya

customer_reviews.title: Good thing I got the Asurion plan so I can ...
customer_reviews.text: We used this camping several times and at first it worked and there were no issues. After about 2 months of using it the piston that you push in to make the espresso stoped working and would get stuck and you would have to pull it with finger nails to get it back out. Good thing I got the Asurion plan so I can get my money back for this.

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: This looks great but it does not work. Pumped this thing 500 times the espresso never came out.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia Ziolek

customer_reviews.title: Espresso
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted to have espresso at home. It works ok, just very hard to press the hot water through. I am 67 and I don't have the strength in my hands needed to use this. And I've burned myself a few times putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bahnmaier

customer_reviews.title: Minipresso
customer_reviews.text: Umm...not really impressed. As an espresso lover, I found this to be to be a tiny shot of dark coffee. Watery and no crema. Tried several grinds of espresso and tapping. Same result. Great idea, but needs work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! You cannot return it if there's a problem.
customer_reviews.text: I guess if you're out camping you've got nothing else to do so why not spend an hour or so to make a shot of coffee. Seriously ours must have a magic black hole inside that disappears half the water you add to it. Following the directions we were able to squeeze about a tablespoon of coffee out of it at a time. Fail! UPDATE: Don't buy this. You cannot return it. Amazon does not honor returns for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Junkman

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Can't return item!! Item is defective and doesn't work after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Leif Aaen

customer_reviews.title: Great shots of espresso.
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our tiny home since we no longer have room for a larger espresso machine. It works most excellent. We love it. A nice clean shot of espresso with a decent crema, and sometimes even nicer. It is quite precise, so you have little room for error. However, when you get the variables all right, it's going to give you a nice shot of espresso. Considering what it is and what it takes to make it work, this little device is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jones

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work don't buy! NO REFUND.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. Don't waste your time or money. Awful product. Awful company. Very upset.

customer_reviews.title: It didnt work. No coffe came out. I ...
customer_reviews.text: It didnt work. No coffe came out. I have to asked for refund.
customer_reviews.author: THE REAL ROBERTO FARFAN

customer_reviews.title: Works for a few months
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, for the first few months. It made great espresso, was portable for travel, and didn't take up space in my small apartment. But the design needs tweaking for it to be a durable product. First you have to really baby it and follow the instructions just right for it to make good espresso. Second, despite the careful instruction following, the internal water chamber seal busted in a few months and it no longer made espresso. The company's support has not been great--extremely slow, and the person I interacted with didn't speak English very well. In conclusion, a great product for about 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Skimmers

customer_reviews.title: NOT EFFECIENT
customer_reviews.text: I know that this is meant for travel, but it’s not as efficient as the descriptions made it seem. The portion of coffee is too small. So if you want a double shot you have to, open up the compartment that holds the coffee, scrape out the coffee, rinse it bc the coffee grounds are all over the place and start again. I like the idea of this but it’s just not efficient. And I’d like to return this. I’ve only used it ONCE. And I’m not able to get my money back. What a damn shame.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Dicembrino

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, didn’t last very long
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this Wacaco Minipresso for 3 1/3 months. It’s already leaking at the presser handle (from the internals) and not getting all the water through the process). I had high hopes that this newer model would be better than the previous. It’s rather disappointing. Also, whenever I used this with friends, they’d laugh and say it sounded like I was choking a seagull because of the sounds it made (with ever press). I could have continued to live with the noises had it not failed so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Doris L Watson

customer_reviews.title: Wear heat-safe gloves if possible.
customer_reviews.text: This made great-tasting espresso and was easy to use after a brief YouTube tutorial. After a year of use, it started to leak after I would invert the espresso maker. A hot just-boiled water leak is not fun. I started wearing rubber gloves. Also, the bottom cup where you fill the water started to form vertical cracks on the inside. The plastic just could not withstand the heat. I would love a gadget that used a more eco-friendly material like steel, ceramic, or glass.
customer_reviews.author: illiniwu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Office or camping
customer_reviews.text: Works great, only complaint I have is that once I'm done with it and carrying it home or putting in my bag to go home any little remaining water/espresso tends to leak. I've checked to make sure the lid/reservoir is tightly secured. Also the portable cup that comes with it doesn't snap or secures the device, which means you can easily lose the lid if you're not careful. Wish I could give this 4.5 stars...because these are just minor detractors.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Sweet mother of god - I am in LOVE with ...
customer_reviews.text: Sweet mother of god - I am in LOVE with this thing. I have used it countless times at my office since purchasing it. I will admit, it's not the cheapest.. but it is durable and has held up almost a year for me. I've even accidentally loaded a bit too much in it, and as a result it was harder to pump. It's not difficult to realize when you're going to ruin something, so just be sure that if something feels wrong with it, you don't force it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry B.

customer_reviews.title: Warning this item is not returnable
customer_reviews.text: Warning this item is not returnable I accidentally ordered the Minipresso when I needed the Nanopreso. I went to return the item, I was informed "This item isn't eligible for return"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Espresso On-The-Go!
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this device is pretty awesome and it really makes great espresso. What I don't like is, it is not super easy to clean and requires some setup each use for a perfectly pulled shot. This is definitely a secondary means of espresso when you need an extra shot and probably best for camping/outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Burt

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth it! I've been using it almost every day at the office, and spreading the love with some of my coworkers. Removing the ground coffee can be a bit messy. (I'd imagine the Nespress capsule would make that process cleaner). Pumping more than 2 cups can be a bit of work (so be selective if you are making a cup for your friends). Tip: use a couple of napkins for the "work area" for ease of clean-up. Be near the tap so you can rinse the filter after use.
customer_reviews.author: kat in a hat

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to big espresso machines
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can make espresso at home without having to spend big cash $$$$ or worry about making enough space in my home for an espresso machine. Cleaning is a little bit of a hassle, as water tends to get stuck in some of the interior parts like the pump and is very difficult to remove. That said, I am SUPER nit picky when it comes to cleaning my coffee products so that might just be my OCD.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Messy but delicious.
customer_reviews.text: The MiniPresso is a solid product and has served us well on camping, road and various other trips where espresso would otherwise be a difficult proposition. My only concern with the unit when choosing to use it is that cleanup can be very messy. wet grounds are just messy. no two ways about it. The trade-off between this type of unit and the k-cup variant is that you can choose your beans and environmentally, grounds are a lot less of an issue than a bunch of pressed plastic containers. There is also a new model which adds capacity above and beyond this little guy. We'll definitely acquire that unit in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Tobias Drewry

customer_reviews.title: perfect espresso shot
customer_reviews.text: what a perfect answer to getting a strong cup of coffee in the morning - just add a shot of espresso made with this simple, easy to use device - congratulations to the designers - it works every time and makes a wonderful espresso on the go - worth double the price! Love this item and now depend on it for that extra morning kick.....
customer_reviews.author: M. Homan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great coffee
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my spouse for camping. I end up using it more but for everyone benefit. This little guy is great! We generally make camping coffee with coffee tea bags. Adding a shot of espresso to each cups is a game changer! This is relatively easy to use although you do go through a lot of coffee. This is a permanent piece input camping and tracking gear.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: not the worst, and it works. Perfect for camping though!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for espresso on the fly, like when you're traveling or camping, however not so great for every day use. Its a bit of a hassle to pump it. Though I am a tiny lady. The instructions are pretty simply and straight forward though. I don't think I have the best grinder so my beans may have been a sub par consistency. Despite this, I think the sheer man power needed is not worth the subpar output
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Not buying this again
customer_reviews.text: This product was supposed to be a step up from the aero press that I had but I found it to be a huge disappointment. The seals leak during use, I have to tilt the pump portion of the machine when cleaning to get the excess water out and even then all the water doesn’t come out. For the amount of money that you pay this product was a letdown and I won’t be buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great find. Delicious coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use although you MUST apply good pressure when pushing it. A bit hard but for a homemade espresso anywhere you are; its worth it. Easy to clean, contrary to many reviews I read, just empty it and poor some water. Good little gadget and worth the price. Coffee was amazing. Bring a hand frother and you got lattes and cappuccinos on the go!
customer_reviews.author: Magali

customer_reviews.title: Makes good espresso
customer_reviews.text: Have used this press since July 17 and it still makes great 2 oz espresso shots. The design is simple and highly portable. If you are a serious coffee drinker that does not require portability I would recommend a dedicated espresso machine as you'll be drinking it faster than you can press it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works but.....
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but a pain in the butt to clean, assemble and use. Probably good for camping but not for busy mornings
customer_reviews.author: Jaynelle K.

customer_reviews.title: item is not making what you wait
customer_reviews.text: i put hot water, and it gets little bit coffee in container, after 15 pumps start drip coffee but it was not espresso, it was like a cold drip coffee. So i recommend don't wast your money for this item.
customer_reviews.author: mehmet istemi bozyel

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish they made this so you could break it down all the way to clean it. Also They need to make a double shot model.
customer_reviews.author: Leticia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Device
customer_reviews.text: Its amazing that this is capable of making good tasting espressos! Only problem was that the filter basket broke after a month and had to have a new one shipped out to me but it was free of charge. While I am no espresso aficionado, I honestly cant taste the difference between the espressos this makes and the espressos I had in Europe this past summer.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Better than Starbucks
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making espresso at the office! I usually grind up some fresh coffee beans in the morning before work, then all I need when I get there is hot water and microwaved milk. The taste is definitely better than Starbucks (if you use fresh beans), but not as good as a decent cafe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little espresso maker!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot tell you how we LOVE this espresso maker! It makes a perfect cup of espresso, complete with a perfect layer of "crema" on top...easy to use, easy to clean, easy to store - LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: R. Senatore

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product yesterday. I tried it out today and couldn't have been more disappointed. I had done plenty of research before purchasing and felt like the minipresso would be my best option. The instructions say after 6 pumps pressure should build and espresso should start coming out... it was more like 60 pumps. Needless to say after 20 minutes I finally had a cup of espresso. I'm not sure if I just received a lemon or if it is a bad product all together. If making espresso has to be as difficult as the minipresso has made it then I will just stick to regular coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cup of espresso.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compact solution for making espresso. It is a little inconvenient that you can't use both fresh grounds and the pods for the nespresso. Although they do make a version that takes the pods. All in all, it does make a pretty good shot of espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Wysocki

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device. My first couple of attempts, I used pre-ground coffee. It was terrible. This lead to an internet search on how to make a proper espresso. There's a lot involved with it, including freshly grinding your beans and water temperature. I bought a small manual grinder, dialed it in, adjusted water temperature, and now I'm in business. I can readily make espresso wherever I am (provided I bring everything). It's great for a traveler, those in room coffee setups are terrible. Also great to leave in your office desk. I use mine daily.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Olivier

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot of pumping !
customer_reviews.text: i bought this as a gift for my girlfriend for our camping trips/ road trips. The design is beautiful and the idea is great but sometimes it takes a lot , I mean a lot of pumping to get the expresso out . That’s the only part I was really upset with . But it does work and we will still use it . I probably just wouldn’t buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice gadget, very portable
customer_reviews.text: We tested it today. made 2 cups of espresso. it was simple enough. after adding the boiling water and the espresso grounds, we pumped 8-10 times and the coffee came out. My husband felt that this was the best christmas present of all. he always complains that the motel room coffee makers make weak coffee. now he can use the coffee maker to boil water and make himself a demitasse of espresso.Nice gadget and small enough to toss into luggage.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: My brother loves to camp and he loves esspresso... So since this little portable espresso machine does exactly what it claims, it is his traveling companion now. I bought a case for him now too!
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: so worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is legit, I use this backpacking and camping all the time and I even use it for trips. It’s easy to use, not a breeze to clean but taste delicious and is better than a $5 shot at your local coffee shop.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Not best
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use, so many pieces to assemble and hard to squeeze the pump
customer_reviews.author: Anya

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the low price.
customer_reviews.text: This product is quite convenient and reliable and while it takes a little longer to make espresso than a normal fancy machine would, for a manually operated and portable espresso maker, this little device is very useful and makes delicious coffee. Just don't pack down too much espresso too hard or it'll be nearly impossible to pump it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for someone incredibly passionate about being outdoors (whether they're biking, hiking, etc.). They were so happy when they unwrapped this! I haven't heard back as to how well it actually works, but I know they had meant to purchase one for themselves a while back but just never got around to it. I think it was a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Y.

customer_reviews.title: I love using it
customer_reviews.text: Look. I had this thing for like a year before I finally used it... seriously... since then, this thing has done some pretty good shots of espresso for me, i use it alot now. You can take everything apart except the main piece but it doesnt look like anything goes in there it just looks like that squeezes out water. Its easy as hell for cleaning and using. I love it. Never had a machine but if this is the equivalent of that then im satisfied. Its worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this. It looked like exactly what I was looking for. Out of the box it was defective. No pressure build up so no espresso. :( Then Amazon will not take it back :( I thought I bought the extra insurance do I could return it. Alas Amazon has been good upto now for returns.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like this and I’m unfortunately stuck with it due to the company’s no return policy; so be sure you want it! Water tank too small and all the set up and pumping yields less than the cup, before it starts running watery. I’m disappointed. Had high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for less than 100 shots
customer_reviews.text: While the idea is good, implementation is pathetic and ridiculously expensive. Lasted less than 100 shots. Now the pump doesn't retract, have to do it manually. Also have the Handpresso, where some plastic (top of the knob) broke off, but functionality hasn't been affected.
customer_reviews.author: I. D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for espresso on the go
customer_reviews.text: This perfect for espresso on the go. I bring it with me to work for afternoon espresso when I'm starting to feel sluggish. It's small and lightweight, but is very durable and makes great espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Portable Espresso Maker
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my husband. So far so good - he’s had it about 2 months. It’a become his new coffee routine he loves it so much. It does seem to hold a little water, but he lays all the parts out to dry and hasn’t had issues
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: dispensing water require hard press
customer_reviews.text: dispensing water require hard press and therefore, it take long time to dispense the water in the tank. the item is not returnable and i am stuck with it
customer_reviews.author: Kal

customer_reviews.title: One year later, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know any other way to get espresso without an expensive machine at home. It delivers a smooth and delicious crema, and is still going strong 1 year, countless camping trips, work trips, and international trips later. Only downside, I have become dependent on this lil guy everywhere I travel now. You can literally make yourself a shot of espresso on the plane if they have hot water! I do wish cleanup was easier, as I feel bad when I'm travelling and I have to pack it when it hasn't dried out completely yet. But I flush it with hot water daily, so hopefully nothing is growing in there.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Woolsey

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IT!!!! WHAT A CHEAP AND BAD MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: COFFEE IS HORRIBLE AND PLEASE DO NOT BUY IT. I WANT RETURN IT AND WITHIN MY 30 DAYS AND HE WAS DENIED. I M STUCK WITH A CHEAP, POOR BUILD MACHINE. GIVE ME A FAVOR DO NOT BUY IT . YES I M A LEGIT BUYER.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: It goes in my travel bag
customer_reviews.text: I use this quite often, since it's easy to find hot water dispensers when I'm on business travel. It does what it says on the box, no more and no less. The only (minor) qualm I have is that it's difficult to fill the scoop when you don't have a lot of grounds left in your box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loves this little device
customer_reviews.text: I work graves so I usually consumed a lot of energy drinks. Decided to try and cut sugar out of my diet so I was looking for a replacement to the energy drinks. I tried several different teas but nothing was strong enough. Came across this nifty little device under the interesting finds took a chance and love it. Espresso is strong and does the job.
